page.title: 01BERNERA:Breaclet.
page.content: This block of Bernera is mostly covered by East Loch Roag,an arm of the Atlantic Ocean. The land area, mostly rough heather covered moor, barely amounts to 3 sq.km. The fresh water Loch Breaclet in the east of the block is almost a kilometre long. The crofting township of Breaclet on the western edge of the block consists of thirteen crofts each with its house. A group of council houses in the south west of the block, two manses and two other houses across the road are the only other dwellings in the block.
